title: Module Federation SSR Dev Server Target
description: The module-federation-ssr-dev-server executor is reserved exclusively for use with host SSR Module Federation applications. It allows the user to specify which remote applications should be served with the host.

port.description: Port to start the development server at. Default is 4200. Pass 0 to get a dynamically assigned port.

publicHost.description: The URL that the browser client should use to connect to the development server. Use for a complex dev server setup, such as one with reverse proxies.

open.description: Opens the url in default browser.

progress.description: Log progress to the console while building.

inspect.description: Launch the development server in inspector mode and listen on address and port '127.0.0.1:9229'.

sslKey.description: SSL key to use for serving HTTPS.

sslCert.description: SSL certificate to use for serving HTTPS.

devRemotes.description: List of remote applications to run in development mode (i.e. using serve target).

skipRemotes.description: List of remote applications to not automatically serve, either statically or in development mode.

verbose.description: Adds more details to output logging.

pathToManifestFile.description: Path to a Module Federation manifest file (e.g. `my/path/to/module-federation.manifest.json`) containing the dynamic remote applications relative to the workspace root.

isInitialHost.description: Whether the host that is running this executor is the first in the project tree to do so.

parallel.description: Max number of parallel processes for building static remotes

staticRemotesPort.description: The port at which to serve the file-server for the static remotes.
